job_details.Functieomschrijving:
For the TU/e HPC Lab, we are looking for a proactive, service-minded, and self-driven AI/ML Application Support Engineer who will help us build and professionalize this innovative service. Do you want to rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day? At the TU/e, scientists and students continuously create the unthinkable. These creative minds expect you to offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.

   You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners. You have AI and HPC infrastructure engineering know-how, but your focus and interest are on the application and workflow side. You will work in a team of highly motivated experts and can help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.

   The job entails:
     * Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI platforms (NVIDIA DGX B200, local clusters, SURF, Azure and Rescale)
     * Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)
     * Optimizing application workflows and pipelines (training/inferencing, pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform
     * Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads
     * Training and communication for end-users
job_details.full_text:
AI/ML Application Support Engineer

For the TU/e HPC Lab, we are looking for a proactive, service-minded, and self-driven AI/ML Application Support Engineer who will help us build and professionalize this innovative service. Do you want to rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person? Do you want to be challenged every day? At the TU/e, scientists and students continuously create the unthinkable. These creative minds expect you to offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today.

   You will closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners. You have AI and HPC infrastructure engineering know-how, but your focus and interest are on the application and workflow side. You will work in a team of highly motivated experts and can help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students.

   The job entails:
     * Assisting researchers and students to efficiently deploy scientific workloads on the various AI platforms (NVIDIA DGX B200, local clusters, SURF, Azure and Rescale)
     * Working with researchers to understand and optimize their application (benchmarking, code optimization)
     * Optimizing application workflows and pipelines (training/inferencing, pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.) to make the best use of a given platform
     * Benchmarking and administration/accounting of workloads
     * Training and communication for end-users

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on supporting researchers and students in deploying and optimizing existing AI/ML applications and workflows on HPC infrastructure. It lacks the core responsibilities of developing, fine-tuning, or building new generative models or predictive systems, which are central to ML Engineer and GenAI Engineer roles.

phrases.phrase: help us build and professionalize this innovative service
phrases.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of the need to develop and improve a service, aligning with business goals of professionalization and innovation.

phrases.phrase: offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today
phrases.justification: This highlights the need to understand future needs and translate them into technical solutions, a key aspect of business understanding.

phrases.phrase: closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners
phrases.justification: This implies understanding the needs and requirements of various stakeholders to provide appropriate solutions.

phrases.phrase: help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students
phrases.justification: This points to a strategic understanding of how the role contributes to the broader goals of the institution and its users.
This is a direct mention of a component within data engineering, related to managing where and how data is stored.
While broad, 'AI platforms' implies interaction with systems that run AI models, suggesting some level of understanding of modeling concepts.

phrases.phrase: scientific workloads on the various AI platforms
phrases.justification: This indicates supporting the execution of tasks that involve AI models, implying a need to understand how models are trained and run.
Optimizing applications often involves understanding the underlying models and their performance characteristics.
These are core processes in the lifecycle of machine learning models, indicating involvement in or support of modeling activities.
Focusing on the application side suggests involvement in how AI/ML models are integrated and used within software systems.
This implies working with the code and structure of applications to improve performance.
This involves improving the sequence of operations within an application, which is a software development concern.
Deployment is a key aspect of MLOps, ensuring models and applications are made available for use.

phrases.phrase: AI platforms (NVIDIA DGX B200, local clusters, SURF, Azure and Rescale)
phrases.justification: Managing and supporting infrastructure like AI platforms and cloud services falls under operations engineering.
High-Performance Computing infrastructure management is closely related to MLOps, especially in a research context.

phrases.phrase: optimize application workflows and pipelines (training/inferencing, pre-processing, simulation, post-processing, data storage, etc.)
phrases.justification: Optimizing pipelines for training, inferencing, and data handling are core MLOps activities.
Benchmarking and resource management (administration/accounting) are operational tasks for production systems.
These traits indicate a proactive approach to identifying and solving problems and a focus on delivering service.

phrases.phrase: rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person
phrases.justification: This suggests a drive for continuous improvement and tackling challenges, indicative of problem-solving.
Implies an eagerness to face and solve complex problems.

phrases.phrase: offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today
phrases.justification: This requires creative problem-solving to address future needs.
Requires analyzing existing applications and finding ways to improve them, a problem-solving task.
This is a direct task of improving existing processes, which involves problem-solving.

phrases.phrase: closely work with researchers, students of all departments, and TU/e institutes as well as with industry partners
phrases.justification: This explicitly states the need to collaborate with diverse groups of people.
This directly involves communicating technical information to a non-technical audience.

phrases.phrase: rise above yourself, in your profession, and as a person
phrases.justification: Suggests a commitment to personal and professional growth, implying continuous learning.
Indicates an openness to new and difficult situations, requiring adaptability.

phrases.phrase: offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today
phrases.justification: This requires adapting to future needs and developing novel solutions, implying learning and adaptability.
These traits suggest taking initiative and ownership of tasks and services.

phrases.phrase: build and professionalize this innovative service
phrases.justification: This points to a role in developing and improving services, often requiring an innovative mindset and ownership.

phrases.phrase: offer them a solution for tomorrow that doesn't exist today
phrases.justification: This implies a drive to innovate and create new solutions.

phrases.phrase: help us shape the future of our university, scientists, and students
phrases.justification: This suggests a desire to take ownership and contribute to the future direction.
